summary: HEAD LIGHT GOES ON-OFF FREQUENTLY. AUTO DELAY OFF SWITCH IS OPERATIONAL EVEN THOUGH HEAD LIGHT GETTING ON-OFF. I FOUND THAT THIS VEHICLE HAS BEEN RECALLED FOR THIS ISSUE.

FOR THE SECOND TIME IN APPROXIMATELY 1 YEAR, THE HEADLIGHTS STARTED TURNING OFF AN ON WHEN DRIVING HOME ON THE FREEWAY 4 NIGHTS AGO.  THE FIRST TIME THIS HAPPENED A YEAR AGO, THE HEADLIGHT SWITCH , BURNED WIRE AND BURNED CONNECTOR WERE REPLACED. THE CAR IS CURRENTLY PARKED AS I FEEL IT IS UNSAFE TO DRIVE WITH THE OVERHEATING WIRING.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS. WHILE DRIVING AT AN UNKNOWN SPEED, THE VEHICLE LEAKED BRAKE FLUID AND FAILED. THE BRAKE WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED INTERMITTENTLY. THE FAILURE RECURRED SEVERAL TIMES. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 88,639.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE ABS BRAKE SYSTEM LEAKED FLUID CAUSING THE BRAKE PEDAL TO HIT THE FLOORBOARD, WHEN DEPRESSED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS. WHILE DRIVING AT APPROXIMATELY 50 MPH, THE HEADLIGHTS, TAIL LIGHTS, AND INSTRUMENT PANEL LIGHTING FAILED TO ILLUMINATE. IN ADDITION, THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE DASHBOARD WAS HOT. THE FAILURE RECURRED NUMEROUS TIMES. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 200,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 35 MPH THE HEADLIGHTS AND TAIL LIGHTS STOPPED ILLUMINATING. THE CONTACT STOPPED THE VEHICLE.AFTER CONTINUALLY SWITCHING THE HEADLIGHT SWITCH ON AND OFF, THE LIGHTS EVENTUALLY ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR A DIAGNOSTIC TEST. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 120,000.

SMOKE WAS COMING OUT FROM UNDER THE HOOD WHILE DRIVING THE CAR USING CRUISE CONTROL.  PULLED OVER AND CHECKED THE FLUIDS ON THE CAR.  NO PROBLEM.  STARTED DRIVING AGAIN AND BEGAN TO HAVE PROBLEMS.  PULLED OVER AGAIN AND SAW SMOKE THEN FLAMES COMING OUT.  CAR WAS A TOTAL LOSS.  *TR

I PARKED MY 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS ON FRIDAY, 2/5/10, NEXT TO MY HOME.  SHORTLY THEREAFTER, WHILE IN THE HOUSE, I HEARD A "POP."  WHEN I LOOKED OUTSIDE, THE CAR WAS ON FIRE.  I CALLED 911 BUT BY THE TIME THEY ARRIVED, FOUND A FIRE HYDRANT THAT WAS NOT FROZEN, MOST OF MY HOME WAS ON FIRE.  THE DESTRUCTION WAS AWFUL.  I HAVE NOT BEEN ALLOWED BACK IN THE HOUSE YET. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS LS. WHILE DRIVING 55 MPH WITH THE CRUISE CONTROL ACTIVATED, SMOKE ENGULFED THE FRONT-END OF THE VEHICLE FOLLOWED BY AN UNDERHOOD FIRE THAT CAUSED THE FRONT WINDSHIELD TO BREAK. THERE WERE NO INJURIES. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS UNABLE TO EXTINGUISH THE FLAMES WITH THEIR EQUIPMENT AND THE VEHICLE WAS COMPLETELY DESTROYED. SHE WAS IN THE PROCESS OF NOTIFYING THE MANUFACTURER TO INQUIRE ABOUT THE LEVEL OF SAFETY OF THE CRUISE CONTROL.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN.

I HAVE PICTURES OF THE FUEL PUMP I TOOK OUT OF MY 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS.  THE CAR HAD COUGHED TO A STOP AND I SUSPECTED THE FUEL PUMP.  THERE WAS NO PRESSURE IN THE FUEL RAIL SO I PULLED THE PUMP OUT OF THE TANK.  I CHECKED THE PUMP WITH A BATTERY AND IT RAN FINE.  THEN I STARTED LOOKING AT THE FUSES AND FOUND THE 20A PUMP FUSE BLOWN.  OBVIOUSLY THERE WAS A SHORT SOMEWHERE.     AS YOU CAN SEE BY PIC 2 THE SHORT OCCURRED WHEN THE "HOT" WIRE INSULATION WAS WORN THROUGH ON THE FLOAT BRACKET.  IN ORDER TO BLOW A 20A FUSE THERE MUST HAVE BEEN A SPARK.  FORTUNATELY, IT APPEARS THAT THE CONTACT POINT WAS UNDER THE LEVEL OF THE GASOLINE WHEN THE SHORT OCCURRED AND NOTHING ELSE HAPPENED.  IF THE POINT HAD BEEN ABOVE THE GASOLINE IN THE VAPOR AREA THE RESULTS COULD HAVE BEEN MUCH DIFFERENT.  PIC 3 IS HOW I ROUTED THE WIRE BEFORE REPLACING THE ASSEMBLY BACK IN THE TANK.  BTW YOU CAN SEE THAT I DID USE A NEW FUEL PUMP.  I STILL HAVE THE OLD ONE.     I SENT A MESSAGE TO THE FORD MOTOR COMPANY THROUGH THEIR WEB SITE BUT HAVE NOT HEARD ANYTHING.  AS OF NOW I AM AFRAID TO DRIVE MY 1997 GRAND MARQUIS SINCE THE DESIGN IS IDENTICAL.  I GUESS MY NEXT STOP IS THE DOT OR BETTER YET YOUTUBE.  I NEVER DID UNDERSTAND PUTTING AN ELECTRIC MOTOR IN THE FUEL TANK.     JERRY HOLLAND  *TR

ON PRIOR OCCASIONS, VEHICLE EXPERIENCED INTERMITTENT LOSS OF  INTERIOR LIGHTS ON INSTRUMENT PANEL. RECENTLY,EXPERIENCED LOSS OF HEADLIGHTS ON 92 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS DURING TRIP OVER THANKSGIVING HOLIDAY. CONSEQUENCES COULD HAVE BEEN FATAL HAD THE LIGHTS NOT CAME BACK ON AFTER I TURNED THE HEADLIGHTS OFF AND THEN BACK ON AGAIN.   IN AN ATTEMPT TO REPLACE WHAT I THOUGHT WAS A FAULTY HEADLIGHT SWITCH, I DISCOVERED A WIRE HARNESS CONNECTOR TO THE HEADLIGHT SWITCH SHOWS INDICATION OF HIGH TEMPERATURES DUE TO BURNING AND MELTING.  SIMILAR TO RECALL ON THE FORD CONTOUR. (SEE NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 99V103000 ).     I PLAN TO CONTACT FORD AND SEE IF THEY WILL REPLACE FOR FREE AND OR GIVE ME THE PART NUMBER OF THE HARNESS CONNECTOR PART SO THAT I MAY BE ABLE TO REPLACE.  I PLAN ON KEEPING BOTH THE FAULTY CONNECTOR AND THE ORIGINAL SWITCH IN THE HOPE THAT IT WILL BE OF BENEFIT TO UNDERSTAND THE FAILURE MECHANISMS OF THE EXTERIOR HEADLIGHTS.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE REGARDING THE VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL.  WHILE PARKED IN THE DRIVEWAY, THE CONTACT HEARD A LOUD BANG.  SHE THEN NOTICED FLAMES RISING FROM UNDER THE HOOD.  A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED.  THE RECALL NUMBER AND MILEAGES WERE UNKNOWN.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS.  WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED IN THE GARAGE, THE CONTACT NOTICED SMOKE COMING FROM THE HOOD.  THE VEHICLE THEN CAUGHT FIRE.  HAVERFORD POLICE REPORT NUMBER 200070827M140003 WAS FILED.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 63,000.    UPDATED 09/25/07  *TR

WHILE DRIVING AT NIGHT, IT WAS NOTICED THAT THE INSTRUMENT PANEL LIGHTS, TAIL LIGHTS, AND PARKING LIGHTS WERE NOT LIT EVEN THOUGH THE HEADLIGHTS BRAKE LIGHTS AND TURN SIGNALS WERE WORKING PROPERLY.  THE FUSE FOR THAT CIRCUIT WAS CHECKED AND IT WAS NOT BLOWN.  THE DASHBOARD WAS DISASSEMBLED FOR REMOVAL OF THE HEADLIGHT SWITCH AND IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE WIRE TO THE TAIL LAMP/PARKING LAMP/INSTRUMENT PANEL HAD BECOME HOT ENOUGH TO MELT THE WIRE ITSELF.  THE CONNECTORS FOR THE HEADLIGHT SWITCH ARE EN-BLOCK AND CONSIST OF 7 CONNECTORS IN ONE BLOCK AND 3 CONNECTORS IN A SEPARATE BLOCK.  THE 7 CONNECTOR BLOCK HAD BURNT PLASTIC IN THE AREA OF THE TAIL LIGHT WIRE, AND THE 3 CONNECTOR BLOCK WAS WARPED FROM THE HEAT.  THIS IS A 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS THAT WAS BUILT IN MAY OF 1991.  REPAIRS ARE AWAITING SUITABLE REPLACEMENT PARTS.  *NM

DT: THE BRAKE LINES WERE ROTTING.  THE CONSUMER NOTICED THIS ON  APRIL 21, 2004.  VEHICLE LOST BRAKE FUNCTION WHILE DRIVING. THIS HAPPENED ON DRY PAVEMENT.  THERE WAS NO WARNING AND NO NOISE.  DID NOT CONTACT THE DEALER, BUT HAD IT REPAIRED AT A LOCAL AUTOMOTIVE SHOP.   *NM

DT:  CALLER IS CONCERNED ABOUT  VEHICLES BURNING UP. HAS NOT HAD A PROBLEM YET BUT DOES NOT WANT TO WAIT UNTIL SOMETHING HAPPENS. SAW REPORT ON CNN.COM. DEALER SAID IT WAS ONLY HAPPENING WITH SOME VEHICLES, AND IT MAY NOT BE CALLER'S CAR. CALLER SAW  VEHICLE ON THE NHTSA WEBSITE. MANUFACTURER GAVE CALLER A REFERENCE ID 1481671685. THEY CHECKED HIS VIN,AND HIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INVOLVED IN RECALL. CALLER WAS CONFUSED FROM ALL THE INFORMATION HE WAS GETTING FROM NHTSA , THE STORY ON CNN, AND WHAT FORD WAS TELLING HIM.*AK
NO WARNING BEFOREHAND, CAR WAS DESTROYED BY A FIRE THAT STARTED IN THE LEFT FRONT ENGINE AREA.

CONSUMER DROVE HOME, PARKED THE VEHICLE UNDER THE CARPORT, WENT INTO THE HOUSE,THEN  HEARD AN EXPLOSION.  CONSUMER  LOOKED OUT OF  THE DOOR AND DISCOVERED A FIRE COMING  FROM THE LEFT WHEEL WELL.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED, EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE,  AND THE VEHICLE WAS TOTALED.    THIS VEHICLE NOT INCLUDED IN THE  CRUISE NHTSA RECALL 99V124000.  *AK  CONSUMER NEVER RECEIVED RECALL REGARDING CRUISE CONTROL.  CRUISE CONTROL FAILED JUST AS STATED IN RECALL.   *TT

MY 1992 GRAND MARQUIS WAS TAKEN IN FOR WHAT WAS A MINOR MISS IN THE ENGINE.  THE MACHANIC SAID THE COMPUTER SHOWED A CODE 214.  HE REPLACED THE COOLANT TEMPERATURE SENSOR/SWITCH (FOR COMPUTER) PER THE CODE IN THE CAR'S COMPUTER.  THE CAR WAS RETURNED TO ME AND I DROVE IT TO WORK, ABOUT FIVE MINUTES AWAY FROM THE REPAIR SHOP.   ABOUT 4 HOURS LATER I GOT IN THE CAR TO DRIVE HOME AND IT STARTED MISSING REAL BAD, LIKE IT WAS NOT GETTING ENOUGH GAS AND ABOUT TO SHUT OFF.  MY CAR HAS BEEN TO A FORD DEALRSHIP WHO WANTED $1,700 IN VEHICALE PREPARATION COST BEFORE DEALING WITH WHAT MAY BE THE PROBLEM.  ANOTHER MACHANIC WHO USE TO WORK FOR A FORD DEALERSHIP CHECK THE CAR AND COULD NOT REMOVE THE COD 214.  THE MACHANIC REPLACED THE CAM SENSOR, THE CRANK SENSOR, THE COOLANT SENSOR, THE AIR FLOW DUCT AND INSTALLED A NEW SET OF PLUG WIRES.  IT IS NOW JULY AND I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO DRIVE MY CAR SINCE MARCH 17TH.  WHAT WAS A PERFECTLY GOOD CAR IN MARCH IS NOW A PEACE OF JUNK.  OTHER THAN THIS PROBLEM THE CAR IS IN OUTSTANDING CONDITION.  IT IS SUSPECT THAT THIS PROBLEM MAY BE ELECTICAL IN NATURE AND I BELIEVE THAT LINCOLN/MERCURY SHOULD AT LEAST ASSIST IN CORRECTING THIS PROBLEM BECAUSE IT APPEARS TO BE BASED ON A  LIMITING FACTOR OF THE MANUFACTURING OF THE VEHICLE'S COMPONENTS. *AK

MY WIFE WAS DELIVERING NEWSPAPERS WHEN THE CAR STARTED TO PULL TO THE LEFT SHE THOUGHT SHE WAS GETTING A FLAT SO SHE DROVE TO THE NEAREST GAS STATION TO GET AIR SHE THEN GOT OUT INSPECTED THE TIRE AND FOUND IT TO BE OK SO SHE WENT BACK TO THROWING PAPERS AND THE CAR SMELLED BAD SO SHE STOPED AND GOT OUT TO LOOK AT IT AGAIN AND FIRE WAS COMMING OUT FROM THE WHEEL WELL SHE RAN UP TO A HOUSE AND KNOKED ON THE DOOR AND ASKED FOR A HOSE THEY CALLED 911 AS SHE PUT OUT THE FIRE.  *JB
THE HEADLIGHTS FAILED WHILE DRIVING. THE CONSUMER TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER AND THEY REPLACED THE HEADLIGHT SWITCH.  *JB

THE CONSUMER WAS CONCERNED THAT IF SHE WAS INVOLVED IN A REAR END COLLISION,  THE VEHICLE WOULD CATCH ON FIRE. THE DEALER STATED A RECALL HAD BEEN ISSUED, BUT ONLY FOR POLICE VEHICLES. *AK  THE  CONSUMER IS AFRAID TO RIDE IN THE VEHICLE.  (DAUGHTER MINNIE ORMEROD ON BEHALF OF MOTHER ROSALYN ORMEROD).  *PH   *JB

THE LIGHT SWITCH ASSEMBLY ON MY 1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS THAT CONTROLS THE HEADLAMPS, TAIL AND BRAKE LIGHTS HAS FAILED TWICE WITHIN A 7 YEAR PERIOD REQUIRING FULL REPLACEMENT.  WHEN THE FAILURE OCCURS, ALL BRAKE AND TAIL LIGHTS FAIL TO OPERATE AS WELL AS THE DASHBOARD LIGHTS.*AK
THE ENGINE DROPPED FROM THE VEHICLE, THE DEALER REFUSED TO LOOK AT THE VEHICLE, WHO STATED THE VEHICLE WAS TOO OLD AND HAD TOO MANY MILES.     *JB

THE SPEEDOMETER SHOWS A MUCH LESS SPEED THAN ACTUAL SPEED TRAVELING.  CONTACTED A COUPLE OF FORD DEALERSHIP WHO INFORMED ME THAT THEY DO NOT AND CANNOT FIX THIS PROBLEM AND I WAS REFERRED TO A LOCAL SPEED TEST SHOP. THE VEHICLE WAS TESTED ON A CERTIFIED MACHINE, THE TEST RESULTS WERE AS FOLLOWS (SPEEDOMETER INDICATION/ACTUAL VEHICLE SPEED):  25/30  30/37  35/43   40/50  45/54  50/60  55/66  60/72  65/80  ALSO, THE ODOMETER REGISTERS 95 MILES FOR EVERY 100 MILES TRAVELED.  THE VEHICLE HAS ABOUT 103,000 MILES ON IT, AND THE MALFUNCTION HAS CAUSED FINANCIAL PROBLEMS (SPEED VIOLATION) AS WELL AS ENDANGERING SELF AND OTHERS WITHOUT EVEN BEING AWARE OF THE FACT THAT THE CAR IS TRAVELING AT DANGEROUS SPEEDS, ESPECIALLY ON 65 MPH AND 70 MPH EXPRESSWAYS.  THE TEST SHOP INFORMED ME THAT THE SPEED DIFFERENTIAL INCREASES AT HIGHER SPEEDS AND COULD RESULT IN SPEEDS WAY OVER 30 MPH ABOVE THE SPEEDOMETER INDICATION.*JB
CONSUMER STATED THE TRANSMISSION WAS SLIPPING, ALSO LOST POWER IN THE ENGINE, ENGINE BEGIN TO SMOKE. TS
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK

THE DIGITAL DASH DISPLAY  DOES NOT LIGHT UP AND FORD SAYS THEY DO NOT MAKE THE PART TO REPAIR IT, ANYMORE. THEY SAY THEY ARE UNABLE TO REPAIR IT AND  THEY CAN GIVE US NOTHING FOR THE CAR ON TRADE IN AS THEY CANNOT  RESELL IT. WELL THEY SOLD IT TO US. ANYWAY, WE CAN'T DRIVE A CAR WITHOUT THE DISPLAY...NO  SPEEDOMETER, NO FUEL INDICATOR, NO NOTHING..*AK
WHILE DRIVING, ANOTHER DRIVER SIGNALED CONSUMER INDICATING THERE WAS A FIRE COMING FROM UNDER VEHICLE. CONSUMER IMMEDIATELY PULLED OVER, GOT OUT OF VEHICLE AND SECONDS LATER VEHICLE EXPLODED.*AK  *YH
CONSUMER STATES THAT WHILE DRIVING THE VEHICLE AT 40 MPH THE HEADLIGHTS WILL START TO GO ON AND OFF. CONTACTED DEALER AND THE DEALER IS NOT WILLING TO DO ANYTHING.   NLM

I HAVE NOT EXPIERENCED A FAILURE TO MY CAR (EXCEPT THAT THE DRIVE TRAIN HAD TO BE REPLACED BEFORE 50,000 MILES). I AM SENDING THIS INFO. BECAUSE  I DISCOVERED THAT THERE HAD BEEN A RECALL(NHTSA CAMPAIGN #99V124000). I WANT TO FIND A DEALER IN OR NEAR MY AREA TO REPLACE AND INSTALL A "NEW SPEED CONTROL DEACTIVATION SWITCH AND CONNECTOR SHELL) MY CAR WAS BOUGHT FROM A USED CAR AUTO SALES PLACE.,NOT AN ACTUAL MERCURY DEALER. CAN YOU PLEASE ADVISE ME ON HOW TO PROCEED IN HAVING THIS DEFECT TO MY CAR REPAIRED? YOUR HELP AND GUIDENCE IS APPRECIATED. SINCERELY, MRS. [XXX]. components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,AIR BAGS,VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL
summary: DURING  A FRONTAL COLLISION, THE DRIVER'S AIRBAG DID NOT DEPLOY, CONSUMER SUFFERED KNEE INJURIES, AND HIT HIS HEAD ON THE STEERING WHEEL.*AK  CONSUMER STATES THE GAS PEDAL STUCK WHICH CAUSED  THE ACCIDENT. *YH
WHILE PLACING VEHICLE IN DRIVE AND WITHOUT WARNING VEHICLE ACCELERATED AT HIGH SPEED, CAUSING MAJOR DAMAGE TO PROPERTY.*AK
VEHICLE ACCELERATED OUT OF CONTROL AND  WAS INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT AT HIGH SPEED, RESULTING IN  PROPERTY DAMAGE.   CONSUMER SUSTAINED   INJURIES. *AK
AIRBAG ALARM KEPT GOING OFF, AND THE AIRBAG LIGHT ILLUMINATED. TOOK VEHICLE TO A MECHANIC,AND MECHANIC DIAGNOSED CONNECTING CHIP IN AIRBAG NEEDED REPLACING.*AK  *YH
REPORTED BY INSURANCE CARRIER. NO SAFETY DEFECT NOTED. *AK

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL
summary: WHILE DRIVING ON HIGHWAY ABOUT 65 MPH WITH SPEED CONTROL ON, CONSUMER STEPPED ON BRAKE PEDAL TO REDUCE SPEED, ENGINE SHUTDOWN. CONSUMER HAD TO DRIVE TO SIDE OF ROAD. AFTER A FEW MINUTES ENGINE WOULD START WORKING AGAIN. *AK  CONSUMER WAS INFORMED BY DEALER THAT CRUISE CONTROL WAS NOT A FACTOR, HOWEVER THEY COULD NOT DETERMINE THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM.*JB
PLASTIC HEADLIGHT LENSES ARE DISCOLORED, CAUSING  HEADLIGHTS TO BE EXTREMELY DIM.  PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.*AK

WHEN I PURCHASED THE CAR IN JUNE 1999 THE PREVIOUS OWNER (WHO HAD BOUGHT THE CAR NEW HIMSELF) HAD ALREADY HAD THE ROTORS REPLACED 1 TIME AND TURNED 5 TIMES.  WHEN I BOUGHT THE CAR I IMMEDIATELY HAD NEW ROTORS PUT ON.  SINCE THEN I HAVE HAD THE ROTORS REPLACED 1 MORE TIME AND TURNED 5 MORE TIMES.  AND AFTER I GET THEM TURNED IT USUALLY ONLY TAKES A WEEK OR TWO FOR THE ROTORS TO WARP AGAIN AND THE TERRIBLE VIBRATION WHEN BRAKING RETURNS.  I ALSO HAVE A LEAK IN THE BRAKE LINE SOMEWHERE.  I HAVE TO "TOP OFF" THE BRAKE FLUID AT LEAST EVERY COUPLE OF WEEKS.  AND I HAVE NO EMERGENCY BRAKE.  PLEASE HELP!!  AS A SINGLE MOM WITH A 2 AND 4 YEAR OLD IT IS VERY DIFFICULT TO KEEP HAVING TO HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM REPAIRED OVER AND OVER--NOT JUST BECAUSE OF COST BUT BECAUSE OF THE TIME INVOLVED IN BEING AT THE DEALER FOR THE REPAIRS TO BE DONE.  NOT TO MENTION THE SAFETY ISSUE--ESPECIALLY WITH MY BABIES RIDING IN THE CAR.  IT SHAKES ALL OVER THE ROAD WHEN I PUT MY BRAKES ON AND I'M ALWAYS CONCERNED THAT THE BRAKES JUST MIGHT QUIT WORKING ALL OF A SUDDEN.  I SEE IN THE COMPLAINT SECTION OF YOUR WEB SITE THAT THERE ARE NUMEROUS COMPLAINTS ABOUT PREMATURE WEAR OF THE BRAKE ROTORS AND VIBRATING WHEN BRAKING.  IF THIS IS A CONTINUING PROBLEM, BUT IS NOT OFFICIALLY A "RECALL" YET, IS THERE SOME WAY THAT I CAN GET SOME ASSISTANCE ON GETTING THIS PROBLEM FIXED ONCE AND FOR ALL AT THE MANUFACTURER'S EXPENSE?  I'VE ALREADY SPENT MORE THAN I COULD AFFORD TO TRY TO FIX THE PROBLEM, BUT IT ISN'T FIXED.  AND I DON'T HAVE ANY MORE MONEY THAT I CAN PUT INTO THIS PROBLEM, BUT CAN'T AFFORD TO REPLACE THE CAR.  SO SOMETHING NEEDS TO BE DONE.  HELP!!*AK

I NOTICED THIS PROBLEM MYSELF WITH 2 FORD MOTOR CO VEHICLES I OWN AND ONE MY FATHER OWNS. THE 2001 EXCURSION I OWN IS BEING RECALLED FOR THE SAME PROBLEM - THE INTERMITTENT WIPER MOTOR FUNCTION EITHER SHUTS THE WIPER BLADE ACTION DOWN OR THE BLADES DO NOT PARK. THE OTHER VEHICLES AFFECTED ARE THE ONE DESCRIBED IN THIS REPORT (1992 MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS), A 1990 LINCON MKVII, AND A 1995 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.*AK
HEADLIGHTS WOULD ONLY WORK INTERMITTENTLY.   REPAIR SHOP REPLACED DEFECTIVE HEADLIGHT SWITCH, HAD CAUSED  WIRES TO BE HOT.*AK  *JB
HORN AND CRUISE CONTROL WORK INTERMITTENTLY, AIR BAG LIGHT READS CODE 13 + 34. SHORT IN AIR BAG MODULE, CAUSES LIGHT  TO  BLINK.  DEALER STATED WIRE HARNESS NEEDEED TO BE REPLACED.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING TRANSMISSION JUMPS IN AND OUT OF GEARS,  CAUSE UNKNOWN. *AK
LOOSE DRIVER AND PASSENGER FRONT SEATS.  DEFINITE SAFETY HAZARD!  ROCK BACK AND FORTH WHEN ACCELARATING/BRAKING!*AK
DRIVER AND PASSENGER SEATS ARE LOOSE WHEN DRIVING. HE HAS NOTICED THAT SEAT MOVES, IT IS NOT SECURED AT THIS TIME.    CONSUMER STATED THAT THIS PROBLEM SHOULD BE A RECALL BECAUSE IT IS UNSAFE. *AK
THE CONSUMER CAN NOT SEE THE SPEEDOMETER, FUEL AND TEMPRATURE GUAGES, OR OTHER READ OUTS OF INSTRUMENT PANEL DURING DAY TIME.  NO PROBLEM AT NIGHT TIME.  *YH

WHILE ATTEMPTING TO SLOW DOWN FOR AN APPROACHING STOP LIGHT THE CONSUMERS VEHICLE SEEMED TO PICK UP SPEED, THE CONSUMER BELIEVES THAT THREE OF THE VEHICLES TIRES BLEWOUT SIMULTANEOUSLY CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO HIT A LIGHT POLE,ROLLOVER  AND LAND ON ITS ROOF, THE DRIVER SUSTAINED FOUR BROKEN RIBS AND A CONCUSSION, THE CONSUMER REQUESTED REIMBURSEMENT FOR TOTALED VEHICLE, MEDICAL EXPENSES AND SUFFERING (GOODYEAR TOURING EDITION). WHILE DRIVING  HEAT GLASS ON FRONT WINDSHIELD STARTED SMOKING AND IT CRACKED WINDOW.  CONSUMER HAD TO PULL OVER. NO PRIOR WARNINGS. TRAVLING  AT 25-30 MPH. CONTACTED DEALER ,AND THE DEALER SAID THAT THEY COULDN'T DO NOTHING ABOUT IT.  *AK
AFTER FILLING OR PUTTING GAS IN TANK GAS FUMES FILL TRUNK AND INSIDE CAR.

3 OF 4 POWER WINDOWS INOPERATIVE MOST OF TIME. ALL WORKED PERFECTLY UNTIL ALL 3 STARTED FAILING AT ONCE. WINDOWS WORK OCASIONALLY INDICATING ELECTRICAL PROBLEMS. DEALER INDICATED THIS WAS A COMMON PROBLEM ON THIS MODEL. *AK

PE-00-02O; REPLACEMENT TIRES FOR A 1992 MERCURY, GRAND MARQUIS, TIRE FIRESTONE MODEL FR360, TIRE SIZE P21575R15, DOT NUMBER STARTED WITH HYN3, TIRES HAD LESS THEN ONE THOUSAND MILES ON THEM. CONSUMER NOT SURE IF THE TIRES WERE THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM, BUT NOTED THAT TIRES WAS SHOWING EVIDENCE OF CRACKS, AND SPLITS. ONE INJURY DUE TO DEFECT.   *AK  *MJS

WHEN  WINDSHIELD WIPERS ARE TURNED OFF THEY STOP IN THE MIDDLE OF THE WINDSHIIELD, AND DO NOT GO BACK TO THE RESTING POSITION.   A PART WAS REPLACED BY THE DEALERSHIP,  BUT IT DID NOT CORRECT THIS PROBLEM. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK
FUEL LEAKAGE OCCURRED DUE TO THE BRAKE LINE RUBBING AGAINST THE  FUEL TANK WHICH ALSO CAUSED THE GAS TANK TO CORRODE.  *AK   DEALER INSTALLED THE NEW BRAKE LINE IT ALSO HIT THE GAS TANK.    *YH
HEATING IS NOT WORKING PROPERLY, WILL SWITCH TO COLD CAUSING WINDOWS TO FROST UP WHILE DRIVING, LOSS OF VISIBILITY.   *ET
WINDSHIELD WIPERS MALFUNCTION INTERMITTENTLY, SHUTTING OFF IN THE UPRIGHT POSITION AND DELAY FUNCTION CAUSING POOR VISIBILITY.   *ET
POWER STEERING PUMP LEAKS SEVERLY CAUSING LOSS OF STEERING ABILITY AND CONTROL WHILE DRIVING.  *ET

WHEN  VEHICLE IS IN MOTION AND  IF ABS BRAKES ARE ENGAGED,  BRAKE ACTION IS SUDDEN & EXTREME, CREATING A DANGEROUS CONDITION. THIS HAS BEEN AN ONGOING PROBLEM THAT HAS GOTTEN WORSE OVER THE YEARS.  ABS WILL ENERGIZE BY ITSELF WHEN VEHICLE GOES OVER BUMPS, PARTICULARLY IN WET WEATHER.  DEALER CAN'T SEEM TO REMEDY THE PROBLEM. *AK *ML

THE ABS SYSTEM HAS BEEN AN ONGOING PROBLEM FOR THIS VEHICLE SINCE IT WAS PURCHASED.  THE PROBLEM IS THAT THE ABS SYSTEM WILL "ENERGIZE" AT TIMES WHEN THERE IS NO SLIPPAGE OF THE WHEELS.  THERE ARE TIMES WHEN THE ABS SYSTEM ENERGIZES WITH THE VEHICLE IDLING IN PARK.  WHEN THE VEHICLE IS IN MOTION, IF THE ABS SYSTEM ENERGIZES, AND THE DRIVER HAS TO USE THE BRAKES, THE BRAKING ACTION IS SUDDEN AND EXTREME, CREATING A VERY DANGEROUS CONDITION.  THE REPAIRING DELERSHIP (MANHATTAN LINCOLN MERC, 301 424-7000, "MIGUEL") HAS EFFECTIVELY GIVEN UP ON SOLVING THIS PROBLEM, AFTER A CONSULT FROM FORD (ENGINEER, ERNIE PECK?).  WE HAVE NO CHOICE BUT TO GET RID OF THIS CAR, BECAUSE OF SAFETY CONCERNS FOR MY WIFE AND OUR 11 MONTH OLD.*AK

THROTTLE LINKAGE BECAME DETACHED FROM ACCELERATOR PEDAL WHEN PLASTIC ANCHOR FOR THE CABLE FAILED. THIS RESULTED IN A VERY DANGEROUS CONDITION AS THROTTLE CONTROL WAS COMPLETELY LOST. FORTUNATELY, THE VEHICLE WAS BROUGHT TO A HALT WITHOUT AN INCIDENT. THIS WAS A SUDDEN FAILURE WITH NO WARNING OF A PROBLEM. ON INSPECTION OF THE PEDAL IT WAS OBVIOUS THAT A PLASTIC ANCHOR THAT CONNECTS THE THROTTLE CABLE TO THE ACCELERATOR HAD BROKEN.IT IS MY OPINION THAT THIS WAS A DEFECTIVE PART AND THE EXPENSE FOR REPARING IT SHOULD BE THE MANUFACTURER'S.

WHILE DRIVING ON A SERVICE  LANE TRAVELING EAST,  ANOTHER VEHICLE, TRAVELING NORTH AT A CROSS STREET, BROADSIDED THE CONSUMER'S VEHICLE ON THE RIGHT PASSENGER FRONT DOOR.  VEHICLE  LOST CONTROL AND CRASHED.  UPON IMPACT, DRIVER'S SIDE AIRBAG FAILED TO DEPLOY PROPERLY.  CONTACTED MANUFACTURER, AND THEY SENT A LETTER  ASKING FOR  EXTENSIVE DETAILS ABOUT THE ACCIDENT AND VEHICLE.  *AK

, ALLOWING THE SEAT TO PITCH FORWARD WHEN BRAKES ARE APPLIED. THIS CAUSES LOSS OF FULL CONTROL OF THE CAR WHEN STOPPING. A TSB ISSUED IN 1992 FOR THIS PROBLEM ALLOWED FOR REPLACEMENT UNDER WARANTY. CONTACTED THE MANUFACTURE BUT REFUSED ANY ASSISTANCE. COST OF REPAIR IS OVER $300.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING HEADLIGHTS FOG UP, AFFECTING DRIVER'S VISIBILITY. *AK

HAVE HAD THE TRANSMISSION WORKED ON 3 DIFFERENT TIMES.  THE THIRD TIME THEY PUT IN A NEW TRANSMISSION. WHICH I HAD TO PAY FOR.  THE PAINT IS PEELING OFF AND LEAVING BIG BARE SPOTS. CONSUMER WAS SITTING IN VEHICLE WHILE ENGINE WAS RUNNING, AND SUDDENLY SMOKE CAME FROM HOOD, AND THEN FLAMES. SOON THE FLAMES BEGAN TO ENTER VEHICLE THROUGH THE DASH, CONSUMER THEN TURNED OFF THE ENGINE.  FLAMES ENGULFED THE ENTIRE CAR.  BEFORE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED,  VEHICLE GAVE BURNING SMELLS, BLUE SMOKE CAME OUT OF THE TAIL PIPE, SO THE  A/C COMPRESSOR AND O RINGS REPLACED. BURNING SMELL STILL CONTINUED.  CAUSE OF FIRE UNKNOWN.*AK *ML

I HAVE NICKNAMED MY CAR "CHRISTINE" BECAUSE IT HAS A MIND OF ITS OWN.  ALL OF A SUDDEN IT ACCELERATES BY ITSELF.  I CAN GO FOR MILES WITHOUT EVEN TOUCHING THE GAS.  WHEN I STOP AT A TRAFFIC LIGHT THE BACK WHEELS ARE STILL SPINNING.  I HAVE BROUGHT IT TO TWO DIFFERENT MECHANICS.  ONE MECHANIC ACTUALLY DROVE THE CAR AND IT HAPPENED TO HIM (I WAS A PASSENGER IN THE CAR WHEN IT HAPPENED.)  HE FELT THAT THE CRUISE CONTROL WAS STUCK AND TOLD ME TO BRING IT TO THE DEALER.  I BROUGHT IT TO THE DEALER TWO TIMES.  THEY SAID THAT THEY COULDN'T FIND ANYTHING WRONG WITH THE CRUIS CONTROL AND REPLACED THE WIRE HARNESS AND DID A TUNEUP.  IT IS STILL HAPPENING WHEN IT IS DAMP OR WET OUT.  LIVING IN VERMONT THERE IS A LOT OF DAMP AND WET WEATHER.  I'M ACTUALLY AFRAID TO OPERATE THE CAR IF IT IS RAINING OUT.  I DON'T WANT TO GET THE DEALER IN TROUBLE BECAUSE IN THE PAST THEY HAVE BEEN EXCELLENT IN REPAIRING MY CAR.  I JUST DON'T FEEL THAT THEY KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM IS.  I SAW A DOCUMENTARY ON DATELINE LAST NIGHT THAT SAID OTHER MERCURY OWNERS HAD THIS SAME PROBLEM WITH ACCIDENT RESULTING.  SHOULD I CONTINUE TO DRIVE MY CAR?  SHOULDN'T THE MANUFACTURER SHARE SOME TO THE RESPONSIBILITY IN THE DEFECT.  WOULD HAVING THE CRUISE CONTROL DISARMED PREVENT THE AUTOMATIC ACCELERATION?  PLEASE HELP ME IN THIS MATTER.  I NEED MY CAR TO COMMUTE TO WORK ETC.
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR THIS VEHICLE. *AK
ENGINE FIRE.
